goals.description: Address unrecovered Conversion Rates (CR) and declining Active Order Rates (AOR)
Improve empty conversions and acceptance rates through Charge at Checkout
Maintain Free Add-on take rates over 90% consistently

key_results.metric: Free Add-on Take Rate (new and active users)
Active Take Rate from persisting free add-ons

in_scope: Legal compliance initiatives in cancellation funnel
CDP v2 to fix data lag
deprioritized: Ability to change cadence on reactivation page
Ability to reschedule directly on reactivation page
Pricing Value Experiment (pushed to next year)
Seamless iterations
Search iterations

dependencies: CRM technical blocker for OTP solution
HF rollouts for new endpoint confidence
Marketing collaboration for rebranding and value-driven communications
CDP v2 for data lag fixes
OTP leads test results for future targeting decisions

risks.risk: Insufficient resource planning for adhoc and technical initiatives
risks.mitigation: Proactively account for technical initiatives like endpoint deprecations and migrations; better capacity planning

risks.risk: Engineering capacity constraints due to personnel changes (transfers, parental leave)
risks.mitigation: Plan for backfills: Q1 has 3 parental fills, 2 backfills; Q2 adds 2 FE devs and 1 BE dev

risks.risk: Delayed OTP launch (W2'2026) due to technical investigation and capacity constraints
risks.mitigation: Pivoted to proper technical solution instead of MVP hack for long-term savings

risks.risk: Insufficient space for iterations on existing initiatives (Seamless, Search)
risks.mitigation: Need to balance new initiatives with iterating on existing ones to realize business value faster

risks.risk: Team re-learning technical context when iterations are too spaced out
risks.mitigation: Better sequencing and prioritization of iteration work

initiatives: Multi-add-on pop-up on funnel and reactivation

goals.description: Deploy TPT native mobile app v1 with push notifications to improve customer engagement and retention
Increase Average Order Rate (AOR) to competitive levels through proactive mobile-first engagement
Generate incremental revenue through notification-driven order recovery and upsells

key_results.metric: Average Order Rate (AOR) for App Users
Average Order Value (AOV) for App Users

key_results.target: ~$1.5M ($1.1M from order recovery + $400K from add-on upsells)
30% of active subscribers (~15k users from 50k active subs)

in_scope: v0: Webview wrapper with parity to mobile web experience
v1: Native glanceable dashboard (Next Box Date, Status)
Push-triggered order recovery notifications (last chance to edit, card failure)
Push-triggered upsell notifications (new treats, box shipping soon)
Deep-linking from notifications to order management
Integration with ABBA and Braze/CRM for notification management
Leveraging Client Platform React Native infrastructure
deprioritized: Costly multi-quarter native app build
Native feature parity beyond notifications and dashboard
v2 native features (deferred until v1 validation)
Custom native development (90% reusing existing web code)

dependencies: HelloFresh Client Platform React Native infrastructure
Client Platform React Native shell and container
ABBA (HelloFresh notification infrastructure)
Braze/CRM for campaign management
Bridge for two-way communication between Native Shell and Webview
Existing mobile web experience and code base

risks.risk: App adoption may not reach 30% target, limiting revenue impact
risks.mitigation: Launch & Learn approach - validate hypothesis with v1 before further investment

risks.risk: Projected +5% AOR lift may not materialize
risks.mitigation: Ship v1 to validate hypothesis before investing in v2 native features

risks.risk: Webview-first approach may create suboptimal user experience compared to full native
risks.mitigation: Focus on notification unlock as primary value prop rather than interface; iterate based on user feedback

risks.risk: Email open rates (20-25%) indicate potential engagement challenges
risks.mitigation: Leverage push notifications with 5-10x higher open rates than email

risks.risk: Dependency on Client Platform infrastructure may create bottlenecks
risks.mitigation: Leverage existing infrastructure to minimize overhead and development time

initiatives: TPT App v0: Web Parity POC (Webview wrapper)
Push notification infrastructure integration with ABBA and Braze
Native dashboard development for glanceable box status

entities.context: Pet food subscription service launching mobile app to improve retention and AOR

entities.context: Product Manager and co-author of the proposal

entities.context: Director of Product and co-author of the proposal

entities.context: POC phase focusing on web parity through webview wrapper

entities.name: TPT App v1
entities.context: MVP phase unlocking push notifications and native dashboard

goals.description: Launch v0 (Web Parity) - Webview wrapper of existing mobile web experience
Launch v1 (Push Notifications) - Enable rich push notifications for transactional and marketing use
Validate +5% AOR hypothesis through app notifications
Achieve 30% app adoption among active subscribers

key_results.baseline: Lagging behind Farmer's Dog and Ollie

key_results.target: ~$1.5M ($1.1M from order recovery + $400K from add-on upsells)

in_scope: React Native shell container with webview wrapper
Deep linking from notifications to specific in-app locations
Order recovery notifications ('Last chance to edit', 'Card failure')
Add-on upsell notifications ('New treat', 'Box shipping soon')
Glanceable dashboard showing next box date and status (v1)
Leverage HelloFresh Client Platform React Native infrastructure
Integration with Braze/CRM for campaign management
App installation promotion on checkout page
deprioritized: Costly multi-quarter native app build
Native feature parity beyond notifications
Biometric login (mentioned but not prioritized in v0/v1)
Extensive native development beyond notification unlock
Further native features (v2) until v1 hypothesis validated

dependencies: HelloFresh Client Platform React Native infrastructure availability
React Native platform architecture completion in Q2
Client Platform notification infrastructure
Braze/CRM integration for campaign management
Mobile website customization for app-like appearance (header & footer)
Deep linking functionality confirmation with webviews
Sync with Client Platform team on infrastructure timeline

risks.risk: App Store may not allow fully webview app
risks.mitigation: Customize further to meet App Store requirements; consider hybrid approach with React Native dashboard

risks.risk: Webview performance is usually worse than native
risks.mitigation: Consider React Native dashboard for critical pages; prioritize performance for key user flows

risks.risk: Uncertainty whether deep links (notifications to specific in-app location) will work with webviews
risks.mitigation: Technical validation needed; may require native implementation for deep linking

risks.risk: Web customization effort unknown due to complicated web setup and shared code
risks.mitigation: Conservative estimate of 2-4 weeks for 1 engineer; if exceeds 2 months, pivot to React Native directly

risks.risk: React Native platform architecture may not be ready at Q2 launch
risks.mitigation: Sync backwards with relevant team for infrastructure timeline updates; may delay hybrid approach

risks.risk: Webview work may be redundant as eventual move to all React Native is needed
risks.mitigation: Launch & learn approach to validate hypothesis before full native investment

risks.risk: V0 (without notifications) may have no measurable impact
risks.mitigation: Prioritize rapid progression to v1 with notifications; validate value proposition quickly

initiatives: TPT Native Mobile App - Webview-First Hybrid Architecture
v0: Web Parity POC with full webview wrapper
v1: Push Notifications unlock with native navigation shell

Improve Average Order Rate (AOR) to match competitors through proactive mobile engagement
Generate incremental revenue through notification-driven engagement

key_results.metric: Average Order Rate (AOR) for App Users
key_results.baseline: Lagging behind Farmer's Dog and Ollie

key_results.target: ~$1.5M annualized ($1.1M from order recovery + $400K from upsells)

in_scope: v0: Full Webview Wrapper with persistent web session
v1: Native 'Glanceable' Dashboard showing Next Box Date and Status

deprioritized: Costly multi-quarter native app build
Native feature parity beyond notifications and dashboard
v2 native features (deferred until v1 validation)
Custom native development (90% reusing existing web code)

dependencies: HelloFresh Client Platform React Native infrastructure
Client Platform React Native Container/Shell
ABBA (HelloFresh notification infrastructure)
Braze/CRM for campaign management

risks.risk: AOR lift hypothesis (+5%) may not materialize
risks.mitigation: Ship v1 to validate before investing in v2 native features

risks.risk: Webview-first approach may create suboptimal user experience
risks.mitigation: Focus on notification unlock as primary value prop rather than app interface; iterate based on user feedback

risks.mitigation: Leverage existing Client Platform capabilities and documentation; coordinate with Client Platform team

results.doc_title: Proposal & Tech Breakdown for Launching RTE Brands on the Unified Mobile App (Project ABBA)

goals.description: Enable All-Brands mobile app architecture supporting cross-platform development for all HFG brands
Launch RTE brands (Factor) on unified mobile app
Migrate existing React Native experiences to Shared Modules cross-platform solution
Update existing core native iOS/Android modules to support RTE and related functionality

key_results.metric: Native repos can run Factor app
RTE theming/content support across all Zest components

in_scope: Cross-platform mobile development via React Native
Theming support across all Zest components
Infrastructure changes on native Swift and Kotlin platforms
deprioritized: Unique meal kit single week components for RTE

dependencies: Foundations alliance for Shared Modules infrastructure
Callstack (external agency) for POC development
TAM for full Zest support and 3rd party libraries
Product team roadmaps for effort estimation
Market-specific business needs alignment
Long-term team ownership decisions
2025 Yearly Planning across teams
Product catalog integration timeline
Multi-subscription feature support
VMS launch coordination

risks.risk: Effort estimates may need re-evaluation affecting timeline
risks.mitigation: Teams to re-evaluate effort estimates and align on work stream start dates

risks.risk: Extra foundational work needed depending on POC end state
risks.mitigation: Internal review of POC from external agency to identify gaps (full Zest support, 3rd party libs, testing infra)

risks.risk: Inconsistency between MK rating flow and RTE rating flow
risks.mitigation: Align on which rating flow to keep for RTE screens

risks.risk: Webview links may not properly route to RTE websites
risks.mitigation: Ensure all webview links are tested thoroughly for all RTE brands

initiatives: Unified release pipelines for all brands
